plug.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a small object at the end of a wire that is used for connecting a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity
plug.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The plug on my iron needs changing.
plug.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a place on a wall where electrical equipment can be connected to the main electricity supply
plug.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a round flat piece of rubber used for stopping the water flowing out of a bath or sink
plug.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a way of advertising a book, film etc by mentioning it publicly, especially on television or radio
plug.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: During the show she managed to put in a plug for her new book.
plug.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the part of a petrol engine that makes a spark, which makes the petrol start burning
plug.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: an object or substance that is used to fill or block a hole, tube etc
plug.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: You can fill any holes with plugs of matching wood.
plug.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a small plastic tube put in a hole to hold a screw tightly
plug.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a piece of something pressed tightly together
plug.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to fill or block a small hole
plug.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: We used mud to plug up the holes in the roof.
plug.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to advertise a book, film etc by mentioning it on television or radio
plug.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Arnie was on the show to plug his new movie.
plug.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an attempt to persuade people to buy a book, see a film etc by talking about it publicly, especially on television or radio
plug.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: She appeared on all the talk shows to give her new show a plug.
The authorput in a plug for his new book.
plug.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to prevent a plan or business from being able to continue, especially by not providing any more money
plug.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: We were doing fine until the bank pulled the plug on us.
plug.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to try to persuade people to buy a book, see a film etc by talking about it publicly, especially on television or radio
plug.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: He was on the show to plug his new movie.
The insurance company is plugging the advantages of mortgage protection insurance.
